action: I want to safely and accurately upload contract files with business partners into the system
reason: To centrally manage contract information and prevent risks of loss or tampering
acceptance_criteria: Contract upload is only executable by authenticated users.
Only roles with contract management authority can perform the operation.
Specification of a Contract ID is mandatory.
Processing fails if a non-existent Contract ID is specified.
Upload is prohibited if no file is selected.
Permitted extensions are restricted to PDF and DOCX.
Executable file formats (e.g., .exe) are rejected.
MIME type verification is performed.
The maximum file size limit is 10MB.
Upload fails if the file size is exceeded.
File names are sanitized.
Countermeasures against path traversal attacks are implemented.
Virus scanning is executed during the process.
Files are not saved if the virus scan fails.
Files are stored in secure storage outside the application server.
Storage paths are randomized and unpredictable.
Files are saved in encrypted storage.
Only file paths are stored in the database.
Contract metadata (Contract ID, uploader, timestamp, version) is stored.
The version number is automatically incremented upon re-upload to the same contract.
Older versions are retained as history.
A 'latest version' flag is managed.
Logs are stored upon successful upload.
Error logs are stored upon upload failure.
Logs include User ID, IP address, and User-Agent.
Operation logs are saved as audit logs.
Audit logs are stored in tamper-evident storage.
Parameterized queries are used as SQL injection countermeasures.
Input values are sanitized (Anti-XSS).
The same checks apply to uploads via API.
Rate limiting is applied to the API.
Communication is conducted via HTTPS.
Permission checks are performed during file download.
Unauthorized users cannot view the files.
A temporary URL issuance function exists.
URLs have an expiration date.
Internal storage paths are not included in the API response.
Transaction control guarantees consistency between metadata and file storage.
User-facing messages and internal logs are separated during errors.
The API is REST-compliant.
API versioning is managed.
Target response time is within 500ms.
A notification event is issued upon upload completion.
Notification processing is executed via an asynchronous queue.
